[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/metrics/metadata.rs] [Static: NUM_META_MISS] [Race Condition] Does the Lazy initialization of NUM_META_MISS provide proper synchronization guarantees when accessed concurrently by multiple backup operations, or can this lead to metric corruption? [File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/metrics/metadata.rs] [Static: NUM_META_FILES] [Integer Overflow] Can an attacker cause integer overflow by manipulating the remote backup storage to contain more than i64::MAX metadata files, causing NUM_META_FILES.set() to wrap around and report incorrect metrics that mask backup system compromise? [File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/metrics/metadata.rs] [Static: NUM_META_MISS] [Resource Leak] Can repeated initialization and teardown of backup-cli processes cause NUM_META_MISS metric descriptors to accumulate in the global Prometheus registry without proper cleanup, leading to memory exhaustion?
